Summary Bill Heffernan, PMP & CSM  
BillHeffernan@earthlink.net 
 
Highly experienced and versatile program manager with 15 years of experience in project and program management.  
Manage projects both globally and domestically from new product development and software development to infrastructure projects ranging into the millions of dollars in revenue and cost.  
 
CERTIFICATIONS: 
• PMI-Certified Project Management Professional (PMP) 
• Certified Scrum Master (CSM), Scrum Alliance 
 
Exceptional interpersonal skills, teamwork, facilitation, negotiation, and influence. Demonstrated understanding of business processes and applications. Experienced in all phases of project lifecycles and transactions with customers/suppliers, partner and vendor relationships, and managing small to very large, multi-phase, cross functional projects. Demonstrated skills in driving projects and programs, cross-functional communications, and issue resolution. 
 
Skills Overview 
• Management: leadership, team management, goal setting, task prioritization, escalations, strategic planning, resource management, budgeting, team building.  
• Program Management: cross-functional teams, project meetings, project plans, milestones, risk management, schedule management, resource management, managing quality, communicating project status, establishing process, driving process improvements, conflict resolution, ability to motivate/influence teams, creating effective processes. 
• Cross-functional Teams: Program Management, Product Management, Marketing, Engineering, Design, QA, Finance, Operations, Technical Documentation, Manufacturing, Business Development, Customer Advocacy, Legal, Technical Support, Sales, and Customer Service. 
• Experience managing teams and supporting customers worldwide: US, Europe, Japan, India, Israel, Australia, Canada, the Middle East and Latin America 
• Excellent written and oral communication skills: Effective presentation skills at the executive, management, team and customer levels. Specialties:• PMI-Certified Project Management Professional (PMP) 
• ScrumMaster Certified (SCM) 
• Program / Project Management 
• Product Release Management 
• New Product Introduction (NPI) 
• Projects: Revenue, R&D, IT, Cost Saving, Migrations 
• Software & Hardware Engineering Project Management 
• Leading Cross-Functional Teams 
• Program Management Office (PMO) 
• Worldwide Customer Service & Technical Support Management 
• Critical Account Management, Escalation Management and Negotiations Summary Bill Heffernan, PMP & CSM

• Critical Account Management, Escalation Management and Negotiations Experience Senior Program Manager Synopsys April 2012  – Present (3 years 5 months) Senior Program Manager Syniverse Technologies (VeriSign Messaging) 2009  –  February 2012  (3 years) Program Manager in Syniverse’s Corporate PMO department managing strategic company critical programs and projects in Syniverse’s 3 Lines of Business: Messaging (VeriSign), Roaming, and Networking. 
Note: VeriSign Messaging division was acquired by Syniverse on October 23, 2009. 
 
• Principal Project Manager in the development of Syniverse’s new multi-tenant Wi-Fi Talk & Text (WITT) product initiative within the Roaming R&D Line of Business. Project Managed Product Development Project Plans, Key Milestones, Vendor Relationships, Executive Steering Committee meetings, Weekly Status Reporting Updates to CEO.  
• Program Directed large Messaging ENUM Routing Migration project of Syniverse’s Messaging LOB from ENUM vendor Transaction Network Services to Netnumber for ALL Carrier messaging (Inter Carrier SMS, MMS, OCSMS, MES). Project created an improved, automated Syniverse ENUM solution that no longer relied on a competitor. Successful migration project saved Syniverse 1.9 million in 2011 and 2.9 million in 2012. Project won second place honors in Syniverse’s Technical Innovation Award.  
• Led New Product Introduction project launching new service for Mobile Enterprise Services (MES) business for Application to Person Multimedia Messaging Service (A2P MMS) to AT&T, Ericsson IPX, and Sprint. Drove aggressive release schedule meeting customer commitments and launching of new product on time October 2011.  
• Point of Contact Project Manager for Syniverse’s two biggest customer’s Verizon Wireless & Sprint within the Messaging Line of Business.  
Customer Project’s included infrastructure and expansion growth projects to help improve Syniverse, Verizon, and Sprint Business needs.  
• Managed large migration project of VeriSign ICMMS messaging and Syniverse MMSIG messaging Platforms.  
• Project Managed Netnumber LNP Implementation Project for Networking Business Unit to reduce cost of SS7 Networking Services for Syniverse customers. Savings of $930K in 2012. Manager, Product Support Amdocs September 2007  –  December 2008  (1 year 4 months) Manager of a Technical Product Support Team of technical engineers and managed a global program manager. Worked closely with teams (Engineering, QA, Operations, Customer Support, Product Management, Account Management, and Sales) to program manage the planning and deployment of software production, platform releases, service releases for delivery to customers. Program Manager Amdocs February 1999  –  September 2007  (8 years 8 months) Global Program Manager responsible for managing Amdocs Clarify CRM product and production releases as well as providing strategic account management to telecommunication and enterprise customers. Worked closely with teams (Engineering, QA, Operations, Customer Support, Product Management, Account Management, and Sales) to program manage the planning and deployment of software production, platform releases, service releases for delivery to customers. 
 
•	Program Managed over 500+ software releases on 9 Amdocs Product versions that included releases in Americas, EMEA, and Asia Pacific regions.  
•	Reduced software delivery release cycle by over 50% from planning to release to manufacturing by improving Engineering fix process into Engineering and out to manufacturing and the customer.  
•	Planned overall project release schedules to ensure completion of the project on time and to the requirements (new features, fixes, and enhancements). 
•	Led cross functional development teams for Tier one customers, meeting critical program requirements supporting multi-million dollar revenue.  
•	Shortened time to resolution of customer product defects by 50% by streamlining escalation process into Engineering. Delivered quality releases on schedule and on time for the customer.  
•	Recipient of Customer Care “Employee of the Year” award. 
 
Note: Clarify Inc. was acquired by Nortel Networks on March 20, 2000. Amdocs acquires Clarify CRM Division from Nortel Networks on November 28, 2001. Project Manager Cisco (contractor) October 1995  –  February 1999  (3 years 5 months) Project Manager within the Global Sales and Application Support teams providing 24 x 7 business critical application support to Cisco’s Global Sales organization. Release Manager for quarterly software project releases for Cisco Global Sales Tools, Sales Force Automation Application Tools, Products, and Services. 
 
• Interfaced with cross-functional teams (Engineering, Build, QA Support, Management, Sales, IT) to release software application projects and solutions to the Global Field Sales organization.  
• Managed weekly project plans and schedules of application software projects for support readiness of Quarterly Releases, Fiscal Year-end programs and application releases and communicated updates to global Cisco field sales organizations and theater operations teams.  
• Reduced escalations and customer complaints by 35% by managing escalations and being the internal focal point for each completed release to ensure efficient rollout, product and service quality, and communication between the stakeholders and development.  
• Improved communication by 20% through proactive company-wide communication on quarterly software project releases for Cisco Global Sales Tools and Sales Force Automation Tools. Senior Information Systems Analyst Novellus Systems October 1994  –  October 1995  (1 year 1 month) Responsible for computer hardware and software, network / IT infrastructure and support for Worldwide Novellus employees and company locations. 
 
• Reduced IT support and spending by 20% by managing 500 employee computers and 120 laptops. 
• Improved company communications by 70% through deployment of a company-wide email system at corporate and remote Novellus sites. Project included Project plans and training plans. Programmer Analyst Intel Corporation August 1991  –  October 1994  (3 years 3 months) Responsible for application programming support for Intel’s World Wide Finance “Components Plant Cost System” that provides actual month end process cost, product cost, and inventory valuation for Intel’s components divisions. 
 
• Reduced system defects by 25% by fixing and addressing engineering defect and enhancement change requests on client server applications using Powerbuilder, Microsoft Access, Visual Basic, and PC Focus software programming languages.  
• Improved department system tracking 100% by developing a Service Request database for application software defect/enhancement tracking. 
• Improved Global Finance user system platforms through new hardware, software, and application solutions projects deployed to Global Intel Finance community. Summary A seasoned professional with over 15 years of experience in multiple aspects of running multi-million dollar organizations. Applying experience in Information Technology, Materials, Purchasing, Business Planning, Project and Change Management to leading international teams on SAP planning, development, implementations and support. 
 
Leadership and Management: Managed international teams with over 50 programmers, analysts and project managers delivering and supporting large scale SAP applications. Successfully built and motivated the international and multi-cultural team with clear objectives, performance indicators and proven results. 
 
Communication and Account Management: Ability to translate high level corporate vision into a message that the team can understand and act on. Experience presenting to all levels of management as well as customers, suppliers and partners. Skillful in fostering understanding and cooperation in clients and partners. 
 
Analysis and Risk Management: Proven ability to take informed risks and commit to solutions in the absence of perfect information based on quantitative and qualitative analysis. 
 
Comprehensive Business and Technical background: MBA with APICS and ITIL certifications. Experience in using the SDLC, AGILE, multiple enterprise functions and Change Management as well as a programming and technical development background. 
 
Solid Record of Delivering Major Programs and Projects: Upgraded Intel’s SAP R/3 3.0D Purchasing, Accounts Payable, Materials, Warehouse, Inventory and Quality Management installations to version 4.6B. Designed and implemented SAP’s Indirect Purchasing module, BBP. Effected first ever upgrade of SAP’s B2B module to EBP 3.0 (now called SRM). 
 
I also have extensive experience in MRO Purchasing, Commodity Management, Business Planning and have received APICS (CPIM), ITIL and PMI Certifications. Specialties:Program, Project and Change Management, Software Development and Support Team Management, SAP ABAP and Workflow Programming. Commodity Management.
